channel.title: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?
channel.description:
Well, I have a Belkin router and I've followed the tutorial on Portforward.com & Runelocus but my 43594 is still closed. Could some genius come on Teamviewer and solve this for me please? :)
Thanks if you can.

item.title: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?
item.dc:creator: @Tomstahh Tomstahh
item.description:
@Tomstahh wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Disable the computer’s firewall.

Read up. I stated that I have disabled the Firewall… D:

Read full topic

item.title: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?
item.dc:creator: @Tomstahh Tomstahh
item.description:
@Tomstahh wrote:

[quote=“segaxvi, post:5, topic:458562”][quote author=Tomstahh link=topic=561477.msg4096099#msg4096099 date=1346858574]
Well, I’ve disabled my Norton Firewall, made an exception in Windows Firewall and PortForwarded on my router website but it still says Port: 43594 is closed.
[/quote]

Go to firewall and click add exceptions, then click allow port and enter 43594 and click TCP, then do it again and click UDP.

EDIT: Are you on windows 7?[/quote]

Yes, I’m on Windows 7.
Still needing help… If you guys would like to add me on Skype - ‘Tomstahh’ we could talk there.

Read full topic
item.source: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?

item.title: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?
item.dc:creator: @segaxvi segaxvi
item.description:
@segaxvi wrote:

Tomstahh:

Well, I’ve disabled my Norton Firewall, made an exception in Windows Firewall and PortForwarded on my router website but it still says Port: 43594 is closed.

Go to firewall and click add exceptions, then click allow port and enter 43594 and click TCP, then do it again and click UDP.

EDIT: Are you on windows 7?

Read full topic

item.title: Could someone help me with portforwarding please?
item.dc:creator: @RSMASTER RSMASTER
item.description:
@RSMASTER wrote:

Disable your firewall if you have one, if that fixes it, you’ll need to add an exception for the port on your firewall depending on which firewall your using.

Usually only windows firewalls a pain so here’s a guide for that:

MAXIMUMpcguides - Windows 7 tips, tricks, help, and how-to guides – 6 Jul 09

Open a Port in Windows 7’s Firewall - MAXIMUMpcguides - Windows 7 tips, tricks,...

Learn how to open a port in Windows 7’s firewall.

Read full topic
